Amendment of section 1(1)(e) of the Disqualification Acts
	Section 1(1)(e) of the [1975 c. 24.] House of Commons Disqualification Act1975 and section 1(1)(e) of the [1975 c. 25.] Northern Ireland AssemblyDisqualification Act 1975 (disqualification of member of the legislature ofany country or territory outside the Commonwealth) are amended as follows.
	After “Commonwealth” insert “(other than Ireland)”.
Disqualification for certain offices which may be held by members of theNorthern Ireland Assembly
	In the [1998 c. 47.] Northern Ireland Act 1998, after section 19, insert—
	“19ADisqualification for certain offices which may be held by members ofthe Assembly
		No person may—
			stand for election as First Minister or as deputy First Minister, or beelected as such,
			be nominated to hold a Ministerial office,
			be appointed as a junior Minister, or
			be nominated under paragraph 7 of Schedule 1 to the Police (NorthernIreland) Act 2000 (members of the Northern Ireland Policing Board drawn fromthe Northern Ireland Assembly),
				if he is the holder of a disqualifying office.
		A Minister or junior Minister ceases to hold that office on becoming theholder of a disqualifying office.
		A person holding office as a member of the Northern Ireland Policing Boardin accordance with paragraph 7 of Schedule 1 to the Police (Northern Ireland)Act 2000 ceases to hold that office on becoming the holder of a disqualifyingoffice.
		In this section “disqualifying office” means—
			Minister of the Government of Ireland; or
			chairman or deputy chairman of—
			a committee of the Dáil Éireann (House of Representatives of Ireland);
			a committee of the Seanad Éireann (Senate of Ireland); or
			a joint committee of the Oireachtas (National Parliament of Ireland).”
Disqualification for certain Assembly offices
	In section 29 of the [1998 c. 47.] Northern Ireland Act 1998 (statutorycommittees), after subsection (5) insert—
		“(5A)A member of the Assembly who is—
		a Minister of the Government of Ireland, or
		chairman or deputy chairman of—
		a committee of the Dáil Éireann (House of Representatives of Ireland),
		a committee of the Seanad Éireann (Senate of Ireland), or
		a joint committee of the Oireachtas (National Parliament of Ireland),
		may not be the chairman or deputy chairman of a statutory committee.”
	In section 40 of the Northern Ireland Act 1998 (which makes provision as tothe Northern Ireland Assembly Commission), after subsection (3) insert—
	“(3A)A member of the Assembly who is—
		a Minister of the Government of Ireland, or
		chairman or deputy chairman of—
		a committee of the Dáil Éireann (House of Representatives of Ireland),
		a committee of the Seanad Éireann (Senate of Ireland), or
		a joint committee of the Oireachtas (National Parliament of Ireland),
		may not be appointed as a member of the Commission.”
Consequential repeal
	Section 36(5) of the [1998 c. 47.] Northern Ireland Act 1998 (which has theeffect of allowing a member of Seanad Éireann to be a member of the NorthernIreland Assembly) is repealed.
Short title
	This Act may be cited as the Disqualifications Act 2000.
